column1:
What skills do we require from "[Taking, Removing, Scooping, Lifting, Gathering, Choosing]" to perform this recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes
Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes
Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray
Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings
Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender
Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking"?
column2:
To perform the recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes, Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes, Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray, Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings, Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender, Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking," you will need to have the following skills:

- Taking: You will need to take out the potatoes, cooking spray, and seasonings from your pantry or fridge.
- Removing: You will need to remove the skin from the potatoes by peeling them.
- Scooping: You may need to scoop the cooking spray onto the plate using a spoon or measuring spoon.
- Lifting: You will need to lift the potatoes, onion slices, and seasonings and place them onto the plate.
- Gathering: You will need to gather all the necessary ingredients and tools, such as a peeler, knife, microwave-safe plate, and measuring spoons.
- Choosing: You will need to choose the seasonings that you want to use for the recipe.

It may also be helpful to have basic kitchen skills, such as knowing how to use a microwave, how to slice vegetables using a knife, and how to measure ingredients using measuring spoons.

column1:
What skills do we require from "[Putting, Inserting, Throwing, Hanging, Dropping, Serving]" to perform this recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes
Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes
Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray
Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings
Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender
Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking"?
column2:
To perform the recipe for microwaved potatoes with cheese, you will need the following skills:

1. Putting: You will need to put the potato and onion slices on the plate and arrange them in an even layer.

2. Inserting: You will need to insert a knife into the potatoes to peel and slice them.

3. Throwing: You may need to throw away the potato peelings after peeling the potatoes.

4. Hanging: You may need to hang on to the handle of the knife while slicing the potatoes to keep it steady.

5. Dropping: You will need to drop the sliced potatoes and onion onto the plate.

6. Serving: Once the potatoes are cooked, you will need to serve them on a plate or in bowls.

column1:
What skills do we require from "[Washing, Drying, Scraping, Scrubbing, Rubbing, Soaking, Brushing]" to perform this recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes
Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes
Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray
Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings
Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender
Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking"?
column2:
To perform the recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes, Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes, Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray, Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings, Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender, Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking," the following skills would be helpful:

1. Washing: You will need to wash the potatoes before peeling them to remove any dirt or debris.

2. Drying: After washing the potatoes, it is important to dry them thoroughly to ensure that they do not become slippery when you are peeling them.

3. Scraping: You will need to use a vegetable peeler or a paring knife to scrape the skin off of the potatoes.

4. Scrubbing: If the potatoes are particularly dirty, you may need to scrub them with a vegetable brush before peeling them.

5. Rubbing: After peeling the potatoes, you will need to use a paper towel or a cloth to rub off any remaining bits of skin or dirt.

6. Soaking: If the potatoes are particularly starchy, you may want to soak them in cold water for a few minutes before slicing them. This can help to remove some of the excess starch and make the slices more uniform.

7. Brushing: You will need to use a cooking spray or a brush to coat the microwave-safe plate with a thin layer of oil before arranging the potato and onion slices on it.

column1:
What skills do we require from "[Adjusting, Checking, Looking, Searching, Measuring, Increasing, Waiting, Lowering, Unfreezing]" to perform this recipe "Peel 2 medium potatoes
Slice 2 peeled medium potatoes
Coat a 9-in. microwave-safe plate with cooking spray
Arrange potato and onion slices on plate; sprinkle with seasonings
Cover and microwave on high for 9-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender
Add cheese in the last 30 seconds of cooking"?
column2:
To perform the recipe, you will need the following skills:

Adjusting: You may need to adjust the cooking time based on the size and type of potatoes you are using, as well as the power of your microwave.

Checking: You will need to check the potatoes frequently during cooking to ensure they are cooking evenly and to determine when they are tender.

Looking: You will need to look at the potatoes and onions to ensure they are arranged evenly on the plate and that they are coated with the seasonings.

Searching: You may need to search for ingredients, such as cooking spray and seasonings, if you do not have them on hand.

Measuring: You will need to measure out the ingredients, such as the potatoes and seasonings, to ensure you are using the correct amounts.

Increasing: You may need to increase the cooking time if the potatoes are not yet tender after the recommended 9-10 minutes.

Waiting: You will need to wait for the potatoes to cook in the microwave, as well as wait for them to cool before handling or serving.

Lowering: You may need to lower the power of your microwave if the potatoes are cooking too quickly or if they are becoming overcooked.

Unfreezing: If you are using frozen potatoes, you may need to unfreeze them before slicing and cooking.
